Description: Black-topped red ware hemispherical bowl with a very slightly everted tapered slightly s-curved rim and a rounded base; reddish-brown fabric with clearly visible micaceous inclusions, black on the interior surface and just over the exterior rim, burnished on both the interior and exterior to a lustrous metallic sheen, the rim is slightly eroded in places. Handmade. Largely complete and reconstructed with complete profile.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Northern Dongola Reach, Site P37 Grave (G4) Context 49e
Type series: NDRS type BU5.4 (published form type series number)
Bibliographic references: Welsby Sjöström 2001a / The Pottery from the Survey (p.308, fig. 5.39)
Welsby Sjöström 2001b / Pottery from the Kerma Moyen graves at Site P37 (page 353, fig. 6.8)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sudan Archaeological Research Society
Division of Finds: National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums (NCAM)
Acquisition notes: Division of finds from the National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums, Khartoum to SARS, the license holder.
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 1309x (excavation type series number)
